ChannelChangeText: Channel sets the used radio frequency. It may be changed to avoid conflicts with existing wifi networks. All devices must be relearned when changing!
Check if your Command needs to submit a: Check if your Command needs to submit a value. For example, the command 'write' needs the value you want to write to your device.
Countdown: Countdown between 10 and 240 sec during the pairing
Device map info:
Click a device to see more details. Every device can have only one parent. Devices may change their parent by themselves. There is no way to force a device to a specific parent. (If you see more than one parent link, it may be outdated data.)
You may also move devices for better visibility.
Weak and offline links are shown red. If a device label shows red, no links were found. No problem if a device has only 'Previous Parents' links, it may just not have sent new data for some time.
Do you really want to delete device: Do you really want to delete the device?
ExtPanIDText: Extended PAN ID is the main network id, comparable to SSID of wifi networks. This id must never change for existing networks, else you have to reset and repair your devices. If you use multiple Zigbee adapters, you must make sure that they use unique Extended PAN IDs. Just enter 16 random hex character (a-f and 0-9).
Name: Name
PanIDText: Pan ID is some simplified id (is used by Zigbee instead of ExtPanID wherever possible). This should be unique too. Note: the Zigbee network may choose a different Pan ID than you specified here in case it detects id conflicts.
Reset Info: A soft reset will just restart routines and the Coordinator. A hard reset will clear paired devices data and reset the Coordinator settings too. You will have to repair ALL of your devices!
Select your settings. Then click RUN to: Select your settings. Then click RUN to send command to your Zigbee device.
Some kind of 'device within device'. Eve: Some kind of 'device within device'. Every endpoint may have different functions. If one does not work, test another.
Switch expert mode to enter raw data, se: Switch to expert mode to enter raw data, sent to the Zigbee device.
The value to send to your device (use do: The value to send to your device (use double-quotes if a number is a string).
This page is needed only for advanced us: This page is needed only for advanced users that like to extend adapter functionalities!
Transport Key Text: Transport Key is the network encryption key. Please choose a random key sequence before  you pair your devices. Just enter 32 random hex character (a-f and 0-9). If you change the key later, you will have to repair your devices.
Unbind remote from Coordinator (necessar: Unbind remote from coordinator (necessary for some remotes like HUE Dimmer Switch)
You find good explanations what the sett: You find good explanations what the settings mean
notImplementedText: Here you may send your own commands to your devices that are not yet implemented as objects. It may also be used to find undocumented settings of your devices. Or to test the effects of settings to decide if it is worth to implement as object. And so on...
to make it available for other user too: to make it available for other user too
zigbee-shepherd: You may edit the raw data to send here. Do not use this if you are not sure of what you are doing! Use JSON format (attribute names in double quotes!). Additional properties may be added too. See examples above. (Format as used by zigbee-shepherd)
ExcludeTextTranslation: Here you can add some devices that should be excluded from our description. They only use "exposes" from zigbee-herdsman-converter. After adding, please restart the adapter.
SettingsExclude: Force start adapter with inconsistent configuration (not recommended). Please update the adapter to compatible firmware and recreate your network as soon as possible.
